content.description: This is a fun, wandering route with dynamic movement and sneaky cracks. Climb an easy start to an awkward transition into a delicate, 2 bolt traverse. There is one powerful move to make it out of the traverse, and then you get a more relaxing finish.
content.protection: This is well bolted and has bolted anchors.
content.location: It is the furthest left route at the crag. Follow the bolt line straight up for 3 bolts, then start looking right for your next few bolts. Then work your way straight up to the chains.

content.description: Climb up the moderate slab with 2 bolts. Clip the bolt on the arete, and climb up a bit higher. Things get exciting as you transition out onto the arete and climb up steep, insecure, wild fun!
content.protection: 7 bolts and a 2 bolt anchor at the top.
content.location:
It is ~40 feet climber's right of

Steel Nuts

, just right of a double crack system.

climbs.name: Steel Nuts
climbs.fa: Kevin Rusk and Doug Waggner?  Retrobolted by?

content.description: Wow, this is a fun climb.  It has a bit of everything, crimps, jugs, roof, finger crack, plus some.  Who ever placed the bolts did a great job placing and distancing them.
content.protection: A 50m rope barely cuts it. If I remember correctly 8, or 9 bolts plus anchors.
content.location: The crag is 200 feet from the North side of the road. This was the farthest left route on the rock that I found. There are two more to the right of this... the next route over is decorated with some biners from failed attempts, 1 by us:( Rappel down.

content.description: The far right-hand line on the Pump Wall. Take the arete to the bolted anchor.
content.protection: 3 bolts, and a two bolt anchor.
content.location: Start on the ledge far climber's right of the Steel Nuts area.

content.description: It is easy climbing past the first bolts. The crux is negotiating the roof through the few bolts after (depending on your strengths). It takes big moves to get over the roof, then it requires some balancy, technical movement. It is so FUN! The top section lets up.
content.protection: This is well bolted and has bolted anchors.
content.location:
It is the second leftmost bolted climb with an obvious roof, left of

Steel Nuts

.

content.description:
Climb the fun face. Traverse right to the

Pump You Up

anchors near the top. Bolts are spaced generously and can be supplemented with gear.
content.protection: 3 bolts and one each #0.75, and #0.5 Camalot and a yellow and purple Metolius (optional, but nice).
content.location:
In the center of Pump Wall, climber's right of the

Steel Nuts

area, start on the large ledge. This share an anchor with

Pump You Up

.

content.description: Climb up the slab with 2 bolts and into the obvious, double crack system above. Step right to a fixed anchor and/or continue on for a second pitch (?). P2 details are unknown.
content.protection: 2 bolts, 2 #0.5s, 2 #0.75s, 1 #1 Camalot, and a 2 bolt anchor.
content.location:
This is climber's right of

Steel Nuts

, left of the bolted arete. It ascends the obvious double crack system.
